intro: Campanula macrantha, commonly known as the large bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems that bear clusters of large, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Campanula macrantha is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and is relatively easy to cultivate in temperate climates.
